journal-title-group.journal-title: Quarterly Journal of Finance and Accounting

title-group.article-title: Is Risk Arbitrage Market Neutral: The Case of Stock Swap Offers with Collars

abstract.p: We use a sample of 194 stock swap offers with collars and delta hedging strategy to explore whether a risk arbitrage strategy is market neutral. We find the risk arbitrage portfolio's risk return profile to be positively correlated in a declining market (when deals are more likely to fail and impose losses on the arbitrageur) and insignificant in a flat or rising market. Using contingent claims analysis, we find a monthly abnormal return of about 1.2% for a risk arbitrage strategy applied to these types of situations. Our results show that the risk arbitrage strategy is not as market neutral as some claim and are consistent with other literature on risk arbitrage for takeover offers not involving collars.
